title: GCF of Terms
text: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.
speech: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.
pacedSpeech: Find the greatest common factor of all the terms of the polynomial.

title: Factor into Primes
speech: Factor  4 x  and  12  into primes.\n 4 x is equal to, 2 times 2 x, \n 12 is equal to, 2 times 2 times 3
pacedSpeech: into primes.  4 x is equal to, 2 times 2 x,

title: Multiply Common Factors
text: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.\n$$GCF=2\times2$$\n$$GCF=4$$
speech: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.\n   g   c   f is equal to 2 times 2 \n,   g   c   f is equal to 4
pacedSpeech: Multiply the terms shared by both expressions.    g   c   f is equal to 2 times 2
,   g   c   f is equal to 4

title: Write each Term as a Product using GCF
text: Rewrite $$4x$$ and $$12$$ as products of their GCF, $$4$$.\n$$4x+12$$\n$$4x+4\times3$$
speech: Rewrite  4 x  and  12  as products of their GCF,  4 .\n 4 x plus 12 \n 4 x, plus 4 times 3

title: Reverse Distributive Property
text: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.\n$$4\left(x+3\right)$$
speech: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.\n 4 times, parentheses x plus 3,
pacedSpeech: Use the reverse Distributive Property to factor the expression.  4 times,  x plus 3,
